results.title: The Black cat
results.creator_credit: Edgar G. Ulmer, Carl Laemmle Jnr and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Honeymooners Peter and Joan Allison are travelling through Eastern Europe on the Orient Express when a double-booking finds them sharing their compartment with the gracious but brooding Dr. Vitus Werdergast (Bela Lugosi). After Joan is injured when their bus crashes on a deserted road, Werdergast and the Allisons take shelter in the sepulchral home of Hjalmar Poelzig (Boris Karloff), one of Austria’s greatest architects. Werdergast has just finished tending to Joan’s injuries when the cadaverous Poelzig, swathed in severe black robes, makes an appearance. Werdergast reveals he has waited fifteen years for the chance to both find his wife Karen, and their daughter, and to kill Poelzig, whom he is convinced knows something about their disappearance. The sadistic Poelzig - who is also a High Priest heading a cult of devil-worshippers - decides to hold them all captive, and torments Werdergast by revealing the fate of his family. After Joan starts exhibiting some strange behaviour, it is up to Werdergast to try and save her from becoming the bride of Lucifer while seeking the opportunity to exact revenge on the man who destroyed his life. An atmospheric and chilling classic, featuring fine performances from Lugosi and Karloff in their respective roles. The concept of this film was very loosely suggested by the story “The Black Cat” by Edgar Allen Poe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edgar G. Ulmer, Carl Laemmle Jnr and Universal Pictures

results.title: Friendship beats the storm
results.creator_credit: Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Best friends Kiera Chapman and Eliza Goldsmith have been through quite a lot together. When Chapman’s family took shelter during the torando that hit Lennox Head in 2010, Goldsmith cut her feet running over to see if Chapman was ok. As they weathered the storm together, they share the experience with their family, community and with each other.

results.title: Storm at sea, tornado on land
results.creator_credit: Kelly Lennon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
As Kelly Lennon ate breakfast, she knew it was going to be a miserable day. What followed was so terrifying that it was only when her mother returned that she felt safe.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: The Big roar
results.creator_credit: Daniel Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Daniel Young didn’t feel safe the night before the tornado roared through his house. After it had passed, Young’s family were safe but it had left a great wave of destruction in its path.

On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Bittersweet
results.creator_credit: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the train from Beijing to Lhasa started running again, Maria Savarino and her husband took the opportunity to visit Tibet before it had changed forever. What they found there was a bittersweet experience they will never forget but also never revisit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When the train from Beijing to Lhasa started running again, Maria Savarino and her husband took the opportunity to visit Tibet before it had changed forever. What they found there was a bittersweet experience they will never forget but also never revisit.

results.title: What else matters?
results.creator_credit: Maree Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Maree Somerville acknowledges that, despite the devastation, the day could’ve had a different ending - one more tragic. For Somerville, it has been an opportunity to recognise what really matters in life.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maree Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
